data.title: My favorite local Italian restaurant
data.text: Great pizza.  I love their crust.  It's the closest to Chicago style that I have found in a long time.  Actually everything I've had there is very good.  A must try is the home made ricotta cheese cake.

data.title: Great Argentinian bakery and restaurant
data.text:
Best bakery in Tamarac and surroundings. Great selection of pastries, cookies and desserts. Restaurant offers quick meals, sandwiches, a huge selection of empanadas, quiches, a mini-market with Argentinian products and an excellent range of wines.
The atmosphere and place are good, though the plaza where it's located has some low-income stores and you can see some weird people walking by. Bring a jacket or be prepared to get cold inside!

owner_response.author: Marcos K, Public Relations Manager at Milano's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the comments Sam, we are glad you enjoyed your visit and hope to have you again at Milanos.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Top notch  - Login más  !!!
data.text: Everything is delicious.  The atmosphere is great.  Outstanding service.  The best Argentinian experience in Tamarac.

data.title: Good beef
data.text: My experience with this restaurant is very good. Good meals, good people, good prices and good place.

owner_response.author: Marcos K, Public Relations Manager at Milano's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your comments Cesar, we appreciate you taking the time to let us know what you think about our place. We are constantly working to improve our service and work with the best quality product because that is what we believe our clients deserve. We hope you come visit us back soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Hidden gem!
data.text: Monday's special is the best, steak seared and tender, mashed potatoes like my homemade ones and the desserts are out of this world. They have sandwiches and daily specials, some wines and teas and a variety of Argentinian specialties. Small cafe with a great atmosphere.

data.title: Wonderful caffe shop and bakery
data.text: Everything I have had is very good. Ideal for a Pesful time with friends and family, you can have just a cup of coffee or have a good lunch!

data.title: More than a Bakery....... A very Nice Cafe
data.text: Finally have made our way here for an excellent lunch. Menu is basically Argentinian and we had a great steak lunch. Lunch portions are smaller, so if you are a big eater, they may not suffice.  You order at the counter and your food is brought out to you.  Seating is small and very tight. They have a large counter of pastries, a salad/deli section and also a fresh meat section. They also have some frozen specialty  goods and a display of wine and other specialty good. Pastries are either purchased by the pound or by the piece. All pastry purchased was excellent. Nice assortment of fruity, chocolate, flaky and creamy pastry!

data.title: Awesome place to eat
data.text: Awesome cortadito, pan de jamon, empanadas and cakes....I just love this place...food and serviceis excellent

owner_response.author: Marcos K, Public Relations Manager at Milano's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the visit Adda!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: bIG CHANGE FOR BETTER
data.text:
My previous review was not too sweet, I was not happy.
But went again for a fast bite to eat and must say, the service, the sandwich and the price all deserve a 10.
Then once again a couple of days later, we ordered two skirt stake sandwiches and French fries, just EXCELLENT all the way; meat tender, bread fresh and fries perfect.
Big difference from previous experience, and recommended three couples already.

owner_response.author: Marcos K, Public Relations Manager at Milano's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for the visit Carlos!
We are constantly working to serve you with the best quality products and your opinion means a lot to us.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good Bakery, so-so as restaurant
data.text: Old customer of Milanos (From previous ownership) it is now, I must say, better looking establishment, with good bakery and service, but when I went to have a "mini parrillada"(A small version of the argentinian mix grill) it was discusting; mor fat than meat, smaller than the first time, and the sausage with taste of vinegar, sign it was old and preserved. So after this bad experience, sorry to say, is nor the Mlanos it used to be.

owner_response.author: Marcos K, Public Relations Manager at Milano's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for the visit Carlos,
We constantly improving our services and working with the best quality products.
We will take into consideration your comment and are sure your next visit will change your mind. Have a nice day!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: $7.50 Reubens & Delicious DATE BARS!!
data.text: There was a steady flow of traffic for the entire time we were in Milano's.  Our Reuben was nice but nothing exceptional. There were samples of the date bar and we tried them and then had to order one!  Prices are reasonable and there are lots of menu options. Plus, they have a parking lot!

owner_response.author: Marcos K, Public Relations Manager at Milano's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for the review!
We hope to see you soon
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: This is Where I Buy Bread When I Don't Make My Own
data.text:
Great bread and pastries.  Our 'go to' place for special occasion cakes.  Pretty good lunches, too!
The steak sandwiches are very tasty and the sweetbreads are delicious and well prepared.

owner_response.author: Marcos K, Public Relations Manager at Milano's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the visit Mike, we hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent Pizza!
data.text: We came here in a large group.  There was something for everyone on the menu, from sandwiches to full Italian dishes to fabulous desserts.  The pizza was something different, New York style thin crust with a twist in the crust.  I went back a day later and ordered a large pizza to go.  Call me ugly, but I wasn't sharing, it was that good.

data.title: It has improved a lot!
data.text: I came here a while back and the quality of the food wasn't so good and the service was just alright, I decided to give it a second chance and I did not regret it! Everything is much better, from the food to the service and ambiance. I will be coming back to this place real soon.

owner_response.author: Marcos K, Public Relations Manager at Milano's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the comments James, we are constantly working to improve ourselves, and working with the best quality products.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Really good food
data.text: Milano's has a unique flavor in their pizza. New York style. They have a wide range of specialty pizzas. Very friendly staff

data.title: If loving croissants are wrong I don't want to be right!
data.text: Milano's is a lovely café type setting in Tamarac.  The baked goods are delicious and you can tell they use good ingredients as everything tasted fresh.  They also have a nice selection of wines and coffee's.  They make delicious sandwiches as well.  They also have dinner which I haven't tried yet but I will go back and do so in the not to distant future.

data.title: Great Local Place!
data.text: I love finding new places to eat and this one is very good! I ordered steak and it was very tasty! Never knew this place was here, worth while, little pricey but I would prefer this over the chains anyday! Home cooked meal.You have a choice of sides which I chose mashed potatoes, they were like mine! Oh my the pastries, very nice selection!

data.title: Pretentious and pricey!
data.text: I decided to go to Milano's Bakery with my parents for breakfast. We ordered 3 "cafe con leche" (american coffee with milk), 2 small croissants and 2 very small little sandwiches. I have to say that we are originally from Argentina, and having lived there for quite some time, we know that what was served at Milano's was a regular breakfast in any coffee shop in Buenos Aires, nothing more. I was really stunt at the price of the "cafe con leche", $3 each, not even Starbucks charge that amount. The server/cashier/barista it seemed had the instruction of doing some kind of fancy drawing with the foam of the milk on the surface so it took a little longer to enjoy the cafe con leche with a leaf? or coffee bean illustration. That was unnecessary for this kind of bakery, when the employees are having "mate" on the back of the store. It is something that screams "something doesn't work well here". I don't know if the original purpose of the new owners was to aim to a different demographics but the store is located on University drive and McNab, Tamarac, not Ocean Drive. Take it down a notch and make prices more affordable.

data.title: Taste of Argentina!
data.text: When I crave empanadas Argentina's or pastries to share, this is the place. It has been remodeled just 2 months ago or so, and now it looks bigger and more cozy in ambiance. Coffee is always good and they also have Argentinean wines that are great to bring as a gift. I think this place is good. Enjoy!

data.title: Quite Disappointing
data.text:
My husband and I go to Milano's whenever we are in town.  The factura or pastries are usually not fresh.  This time around the experience was similar and they did not even have the coffee machine available to make coffee.  It simply is not well run.  Is there ever a manager there?  Anyone in charge?  We are confident that if management were more visible and had some sort of rapport with the customers, it would be a more profitable business.  It simply lacks care and attention on their part.  I hear hear their steak sandwiches are good, but have never had them.  They need to make a greater effort in customer satisfaction.  If they had a suggestion box it would be extremely helpful.  I would like to see it prosper.  My husband is from Argetina and he wishes them success but at times feels that if they don't act soon, they would inevitably lose clientele.

If you enjoyed my review, kindly give it a thumbs up.
